gcore_platform.description: Platform ulr is used for generate jwt

ignore_creds_auth_error.description: Should be set to true when you are gonna to use storage resource with permanent API-token only.

permanent_api_token.description: A permanent API-token. Implemented for Storage Terraform Resource only. https://support.gcorelabs.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018625617-API-tokens

block.description: Represent baremetal instance

use_next.description: This options have two possible values: true — The option is active. In case the origin responds with 4XX or 5XX codes, use the next origin from the list. false — The option is disabled.

backup.description: true — The option is active. The origin will not be used until one of active origins become unavailable. false — The option is disabled.

enabled.description: The setting allows to enable or disable an Origin source in the Origins group

source.description: IP address or Domain name of your origin and the port if custom

block.description: Contains information about all IP address or Domain names of your origin and the port if custom
Represent origin group

active.description: The setting allows to enable or disable a CDN Resource

cname.description: A CNAME that will be used to deliver content though a CDN

origin.description: A domain name or IP of your origin source. Specify a port if custom. You can use either 'origin' parameter or 'originGroup' in the resource definition.

origin_group.description: ID of the Origins Group. Use one of your Origins Group or create a new one. You can use either 'origin' parameter or 'originGroup' in the resource definition.

origin_protocol.description: This option defines the protocol that will be used by CDN servers to request content from an origin source. If not specified, we will use HTTP to connect to an origin server. Possible values are: HTTPS, HTTP, MATCH.

ssl_data.description: Specify the SSL Certificate ID which should be used for the CDN Resource.

ssl_enabled.description: Use HTTPS protocol for content delivery.

status.description: Status of a CDN resource content availability. Possible values are: Active, Suspended, Processed.

custom_values.description: Caching time for a response with specific codes. These settings have a higher priority than the value field. Response code ('304', '404' for example). Use 'any' to specify caching time for all response codes. Caching time in seconds ('0s', '600s' for example). Use '0s' to disable caching for a specific response code.

default.description: Content will be cached according to origin cache settings. The value applies for a response with codes 200, 201, 204, 206, 301, 302, 303, 304, 307, 308 if an origin server does not have caching HTTP headers. Responses with other codes will not be cached.

value.description: Caching time for a response with codes 200, 206, 301, 302. Responses with codes 4xx, 5xx will not be cached. Use '0s' disable to caching. Use custom_values field to specify a custom caching time for a response with specific codes.

block.description: The cache expiration time for CDN servers.

Specify the Host header that CDN servers use when request content from an origin server. Your server must be able to process requests with the chosen header. If the option is in NULL state Host Header value is taken from the CNAME field.
Each option in CDN resource settings. Each option added to CDN resource settings should have the following mandatory request fields: enabled, value.
Represent cdn resource

rule.description: A pattern that defines when the rule is triggered. By default, we add a leading forward slash to any rule pattern. Specify a pattern without a forward slash.

rule_type.description: Type of rule. The rule is applied if the requested URI matches the rule pattern. It has two possible values: Type 0 — RegEx. Must start with '^/' or '/'. Type 1 — RegEx. Legacy type. Note that for this rule type we automatically add / to each rule pattern before your regular expression. Please use Type 0.

custom_values.description: Caching time for a response with specific codes. These settings have a higher priority than the value field. Response code ('304', '404' for example). Use 'any' to specify caching time for all response codes. Caching time in seconds ('0s', '600s' for example). Use '0s' to disable caching for a specific response code.

default.description: Content will be cached according to origin cache settings. The value applies for a response with codes 200, 201, 204, 206, 301, 302, 303, 304, 307, 308 if an origin server does not have caching HTTP headers. Responses with other codes will not be cached.

value.description: Caching time for a response with codes 200, 206, 301, 302. Responses with codes 4xx, 5xx will not be cached. Use '0s' disable to caching. Use custom_values field to specify a custom caching time for a response with specific codes.

block.description: The cache expiration time for CDN servers.

Specify the Host header that CDN servers use when request content from an origin server. Your server must be able to process requests with the chosen header. If the option is in NULL state Host Header value is taken from the CNAME field.
Each option in CDN resource settings. Each option added to CDN resource settings should have the following mandatory request fields: enabled, value.
Represent cdn resource rule

automated.description: The way SSL certificate was issued.

cert.description: The public part of the SSL certificate. All chain of the SSL certificate should be added.

has_related_resources.description: It shows if the SSL certificate is used by a CDN resource.

name.description: Name of the SSL certificate. Must be unique.

private_key.description: The private key of the SSL certificate.

name.description: A name of DNS Zone resource.

block.description: Represent DNS zone resource. https://dns.gcorelabs.com/zones

domain.description: A domain of DNS Zone Record resource.

ttl.description: A ttl of DNS Zone Record resource.

type.description: A type of DNS Zone Record resource.

zone.description: A zone of DNS Zone Record resource.

limit.description: A DNS Zone Record filter option that describe how many records will be percolated.

strict.description: A DNS Zone Record filter option that describe possibility to return answers if no records were percolated through filter.

type.description: A DNS Zone Record filter option that describe a name of filter.

content.description: A content of DNS Zone Record resource.

enabled.description: Manage of public appearing of DNS Zone Record resource.

asn.description: An asn meta (e.g. 12345) of DNS Zone Record resource.

continents.description: Continents meta (e.g. Asia) of DNS Zone Record resource.

countries.description: Countries meta (e.g. USA) of DNS Zone Record resource.

default.description: Fallback meta equals true marks records which are used as a default answer (when nothing was selected by specified meta fields).

ip.description: An ip meta (e.g. 127.0.0.0) of DNS Zone Record resource.

latlong.description: A latlong meta (e.g. 27.988056, 86.925278) of DNS Zone Record resource.

notes.description: A notes meta (e.g. Miami DC) of DNS Zone Record resource.

block.description: An array of contents with meta of DNS Zone Record resource.
Represent DNS Zone Record resource. https://dns.gcorelabs.com/zones
A floating IP is a static IP address that points to one of your Instances. It allows you to redirect network traffic to any of your Instances in the same datacenter.

vm_state.description: Current vm state, use stopped to stop vm and active to start

block.description: Firewalls list

boot_index.description: If boot_index==0 volumes can not detached

block.description: Represent instance
Represent k8s cluster with one default pool.
Represent k8s cluster's pool.
Represent a ssh key, do not depends on region
Represent load balancer listener. Can not be created without load balancer. A listener is a process that checks for connection requests, using the protocol and port that you configure
Represent load balancer member

protocol.description: Available values is 'HTTP' (currently work, other do not work on ed-8), 'HTTPS', 'TCP', 'UDP'

block.description: Represent load balancer listener pool. A pool is a list of virtual machines to which the listener will redirect incoming traffic

resource_name_template.description: Used to name snapshots. {volume_id} is substituted with volume.id on creation

day.description: Either single asterisk or comma-separated list of integers (1-31)

day_of_week.description: Either single asterisk or comma-separated list of integers (0-6)

hour.description: Either single asterisk or comma-separated list of integers (0-23)

minute.description: Either single asterisk or comma-separated list of integers (0-59)

month.description: Either single asterisk or comma-separated list of integers (1-12)

week.description: Either single asterisk or comma-separated list of integers (1-53)

block.description: Use for taking actions at specified moments of time. Exactly one of interval and cron blocks should be provided

days.description: Number of days to wait between actions

hours.description: Number of hours to wait between actions

minutes.description: Number of minutes to wait between actions

weeks.description: Number of weeks to wait between actions

block.description: Use for taking actions with equal time intervals between them. Exactly one of interval and cron blocks should be provided

days.description: Number of days to wait before deleting snapshot

hours.description: Number of hours to wait before deleting snapshot

minutes.description: Number of minutes to wait before deleting snapshot

weeks.description: Number of weeks to wait before deleting snapshot

block.description: If it is set, new resource will be deleted after time
List of managed volumes
Represent lifecycle policy. Use to periodically take snapshots

protocol.description: Available values is 'HTTP' (currently work, other do not work on ed-8), 'HTTPS', 'TCP', 'UDP'

block.description: Represent load balancer

type.description: 'vlan' or 'vxlan' network type is allowed. Default value is 'vxlan'

block.description: Represent network. A network is a software-defined network in a cloud computing infrastructure

allowed_address_pairs.description: Group of IP addresses that share the current IP as VIP

port_id.description: ID of the port_id underlying the reserved fixed IP

block.description: Represent reserved ips

subnet_id.description: Subnet for router interface must have a gateway IP

nexthop.description: IPv4 address to forward traffic to if it's destination IP matches 'destination' CIDR

block.description: Represent router. Router enables you to dynamically exchange routes between networks
Firewall rules control what inbound(ingress) and outbound(egress) traffic is allowed to enter or leave a Instance. At least one 'egress' rule should be set
Represent SecurityGroups(Firewall)

policy.description: Server group policy. Available value is 'affinity', 'anti-affinity'

block.description: Represent server group resource

snapshot_id.description: Mandatory if volume is created from a snapshot
